Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text:
The best place to drink !!
Elegant, sober and cozy, the service is 10 out of 10 and the drinks are of the best quality.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Lovely staff! So kind, Johannes explained us the history of jenever in the Netherlands. Plenty of options, delicious jenever.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Amazing local spot! The owner Johannes was so nice and kind and explained the history of genever to us and recommend some really nice ones to us you definitely have to try the meatballs and the sausage accompanied with a beer and genever!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text:
Very good liquors. Excellent service.
A very cozy place. Definitly worth a visit.
Take one of the various drinks, you'll get a good advice from the bartender ;)
Greetings from germany.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Really cool and authentic bar which has a lot of choices for genever and local beers. I would recommend trying their tiny cocktails/shots with genever because the drink is very unique.  The bertender was really informative and friendly ! Loved this experience.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great local place for a drink :)

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: I cannot get more real traditional and alive then that !

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: De Drie Fleschjes ‚Äì known in English as The Three Little Bottles ‚Äì is a historic Dutch bar located just behind the New Church on the Dam Square. ‚Ä¶

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Best local bar, and traditional Dutch cocktails

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Atmospheric small bar with an authentic feel and an all year round terrasse that caters both local citizens and tourists.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Authentic, cosy and great drinks and services. Must go whenever you are in Amsterdam

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Very small bar. Cosy. Very limited seating. Historical building.  Lined with century old casks, rented by private families or companies, filled with their favorite concoction. Just for drinks and a small snack. Sip the head off your drink bent over the counter before carrying it away

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Beautiful, traditional, historic bar, not to be missed! Very friendly, professional and knowledgeable bartender

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great beer, loved the vibe of this place. The beer cans really adds to the ambiance.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great old building, nicely laid out for an authentic feel with the old barrels along the back wall. The bar tender was knowledgeable and helpful and great selection of tasty jenever.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text:
Come here every time I‚Äôm in Amsterdam. The old Jenever on a summer day combined with a light beer and their homemade meatballs is
the recipe for a perfect afternoon.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: For alcohol tasting lovers. Its a tasting house of Bols which is a traditional locally produced liquor. Simon is the person who is kind enough to explain everything and takr you through the tasting

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: *Great beer. But the service. Came on a sunny afternoon to have a tipple and something for my driving brother. Still some seats outside we thought we'd been lucky. We were served by a grumpy man, talking in Dutch - both of us are foreigners ‚Ä¶

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Amazing athmosphere, one of the oldest bars in the city.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A very relaxed atmosphere. The man behind the bar was very friendly and knowledgeable. It was quite small though and we ended up sitting next to a few other couples, which is just not for me. If the weather had been better the outside seating would have been my preferred choice. I would definitely return.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Anthony bourdain does not disappoint. Jenever was great. The meatballs are delicious. The ambience sends you back in time.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Hasn‚Äôt changed in the 25 years I‚Äôve been visiting and is well worth a visit. Be prepared to stand though.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Typical Dutch winery. I have been here to taste a typical dutch spirit. The atmosphere is rowdy and the place is attended mostly by dutch people. Inside this pub there is a very strong smell of wine, barrels and grape must, and personally it disturbed me a lot. Prices average. Very bad beer.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A must-do if you're in the Palace area - the bartenders are friendly and enthusiastic, and talked me through the traditions of their Genever. Not a ton of seating, even in the early afternoon, so be prepared to stop by, take a drink at the bar, and go. A fun introduction to a Dutch institution.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text:
Wowww!
antique bar from the 17th century. The whole place is filled with private barrels. Some bars hire people to just work and make their money, but this place - it ‚Ä¶

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: We visited it since our Amsterdam Card included a free jenever shot here. The guy on the bar was really really nice, and the place looks the same it may have looked a hundred years ago. We really liked it!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A great coffee shop with rows of barrels of wine and spirits. Its like a tapas for the drinker. Located just of the main Dam square. In this city of many great coffee shops, this is a must try.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: authentic bar with history and charm

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great place to try gins. Go inside & talk to the barman about what you like. The gin aged in Bourbon barrels was especially good. Unfortunately, they do not sell bottles

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text:
Cozy. Great drinks, typical Dutch drinks, with a story or explanation if you need from friendly staff.
Can be busy (read too busy) on Friday evenings after work, but generally very accessible.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: No trip to Amsterdam is complete without a stop here for a few shots of jenever and a beer or two. Each time we have visited here has been extremely interesting principally because of the people we met. They included Dietrich who offered us ‚Ä¶

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A must see if you ever visit Amsterdam. They tried hard to keep it as original as possible. That means 18th century pub style. It is sponsored by Bols which is one of the oldest and largest jenever brands. Try a "boswandeling" or a "grave ‚Ä¶

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: This little place was an oasis on a hot summer day. The barkeep was one of the nicest people I ever met. What a spot!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Fantastic and authentic genever bar. The staff are knowledgeable about the bars history (including the ancient casks in the wall) and the genever. It does close early though.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A lovely little joint with some incredible drink options. The locals use the barrels shown in the picture to store their own drinks

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Very cozy place and a very friendly bartender tat explained to us the different types of beer offered. Highly recommended.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Nice place with lots of history. Local companies have their own barrel to drink from. Nice if you find a olace but it is often crowded.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Amazing place with excellent drink choices and good bar snacks. Robin is a fantastic host and we look forward to returning as soon as we can.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Wonderful place! The young server is so cute. Free shot of Dutch jin with the I Amsterdam card. Very friendly and fun place.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Amazing little pub that's been around for hundreds of years. Awesome environment and enthusiastic Barkeeper knowing his stuff. Go visit!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great place. Small and dark with few seats but the best place to try genever with expert advice from behind the bar.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Unique bar, where you can have one of a lifetime BOL alcohol. Kind of personal feeling inside.. recommend!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Unbelievable. From the history to the atmosphere. One of my favorite experiences in all my years of travel. My only regret is not purchasing one of the books they had for sale.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Great historic bar, friendly service. They were very willing to teach me about jenever as I had never tried it before.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: What a typical and lovely place! Gotta love it

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: It's a nice historic place to try jenever. Bar tender seemed a bit overwhelmed, though.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Love this place!  Super cozy, wonderful jenever selection, tasty snacks and awesome staff.  Highly recommended!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Loved the beers here and their traditional Genevere. The staff was extremely friendly and service was just implacable.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: A very cosy spot to have a few drinks in the evening. I had the best beer of my Euro trip here.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Always a pleasure, feel like home..üëç

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Lovely place where staff was kind enough to explain and recommend drinks. Great atmosphere.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Excellent staff and beer!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Found this little pub by accident.  It is so, so special.  Perfect place to stop in have a beer, and daydream about old Amsterdam.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Fantastic! Ask Robin to make you a drink... He is a master!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: One of the oldest watering holes in Amsterdam. Do try their house pilsner to get a sip of history.

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Fantastic little bar tucked away just down an alley from dam square .

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Excellent service and jenever! Great place for an after work drink!

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Nostalgic place for us to go back to. Very nice winery with a old Cosy atmosphere

Name: De Drie Fleschjes
Review Text: Quite pricy beers, but a lot of choices, not so much places to sit
